title: COAST ORB / feldwindows
description: A conversation with SF about the inside of the building and hiding.

dialogueTree.title: Perception (Hearing): "The remaining windows rattle from a..."
dialogueTree.text: The remaining windows rattle from a strong gust of wind. They're covered in a thick layer of grime. They must have been like this for forty years.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Dripping water falls from a high pl..."
links.text: Dripping water falls from a high place. All you can see is the shadow of a collapsing staircase.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There's rust and corrosion on the b..."
links.text: There's rust and corrosion on the bars, they're foaming with it. And a small layer of white salt from the sea.

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, can you make out what'..."
links.text: "Lieutenant, can you make out what's inside?" (Point at the windows.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No." He shakes his head. The windo..."
links.text: "No." He shakes his head. The windows rattle in their frames. "I won't even try. You know..." He takes his glasses off.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I had a partner once. They called..."
links.text: "I had a partner once. They called him Eyes, because he had to show me things. It's that bad."

links.title: Empathy: "This partner of his, Eyes -- things..."
links.text: This partner of his, Eyes -- things didn't end well. It saddens him to say his name. Don't even ask. He wouldn't answer. Maybe some other small talk?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well enough, actually. It's odd ho..."
links.text: "Well enough, actually. It's odd how that works. I'm no sharpshooter, but I pass my shooting courses 7 out of 10."

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "His hands lead the way when it come..."
links.text: His hands lead the way when it comes to that. And his shoulders. It's reflex.
